featuredReview.headline: Great place to work
featuredReview.pros: Smart, hard working, and exciting environment
featuredReview.cons: I can't think of any negatives

featuredReview.headline: Cool hybrid of tech company / finance company
featuredReview.pros:
- Compensation and benefits are excellent
- Tech side of things feels like a tech company
- Attending conferences / training is encouraged
- Friday lunches catered, and an onsite barista at Chicago office!
featuredReview.cons:
- Office lacks common areas, and so there's an eat-lunch-at-desk culture that seems hard to change
- There's a lack of good gyms or cafes in the area around 600 W Chicago

featuredReview.headline: Very well-organized intern experience, wonderful work culture
featuredReview.pros:
-intern projects are thoroughly planned and drawn from actual team workflow - so you contribute a clearly defined and important piece of production code
-mentorship is helpful and available, strong team bonding
-everyone, including higher management, is very approachable - and will even approach you to ask about how you're doing
-meetings and workflow are rigorous and efficient for the most part
-far ahead of the game in work-life balance - people are open to what helps you work best, and working in the office is motivating but also chill
featuredReview.cons:
-intern program is huge compared with size of company, so a bit impersonal
-backend database work is not for everyone, learning curve is high
-quality of mentorship/projects is mostly great, but not quite uniform across the company

featuredReview.headline: Amazing Technology
featuredReview.cons:
Long Sales Cycle
Difficult to set up PoC's

featuredReview.headline: The best of Silicon Valley
featuredReview.pros:
.  The people!  I have worked for Sumo Logic for nearly six months and I am impressed with the people and how they welcomed and enabled me.  There are a lot of companies who talk about "people" being important.  This company lives it.
.   I am excited to play a small part in helping make this company successful.  The company is growing and adding new employees to just about every department.   Revenues continue to grow, helping us move towards IPO.   An exciting time indeed!
featuredReview.cons: A contrast between how welcoming some people were on my first day and how one leader behaved during my orientation.   This leader is not a good representation of Sumo Logic

featuredReview.headline: Amazing growth, business problems, and team
featuredReview.pros:
I've personally grown much faster than I expected. I've learned as much about software engineering as I have about product decision-making, analytics, and project management—all as a new-grad hire.

Almost everyone here is exceptionally helpful and cooperative. The company is intensely mission-driven and people are well-aligned with the company's vision.

People here are smart. With few exceptions, I am impressed by the caliber of team members here and the lengths they go to not only understand our customers, product, and market.

There is immense company growth potential. We are years ahead of even our biggest competitors in a market that, in the US alone, is worth $700 billion annually. There are few other tech companies that can even claim to have that much potential for growth—let alone a strong chance at realizing that potential.

Upper management is excellent. I rarely question the decisions made by executives about our team and our product because they are accessible, transparent about their reasoning, and deeply concerned with data-driven decision-making. At the same time, they seem to balance these traits with well-honed intuitions about how to make step changes in the product that take us in the right direction.
featuredReview.cons:
While the company has been receptive to feedback about career growth, it still has room for improvement. I realize catering to people's career growth needs is often in tension with team agility and bureaucracy minimization, but I think Thumbtack is capable of finding a better balance.

Given our ambitions, we need to grow our team more quickly than we currently are, without resorting to the pell-mell of hiring that was 2016. I think a crucial part of this will be polishing our brand and doing better at publicizing the great work we're doing here.

featuredReview.headline: Had a great experience with the team here
featuredReview.pros:
Flexible, smart team
Great WeWork location 
Hours were good
Pretty relaxed, flexible environment
featuredReview.cons:
It's a tech startup, so things can get a little hectic, and senior management is managing a lot, but that's to be expected. 
If you need a clear structure with hand holding, this probably isn't the place for you. 
Not for someone that's new to the technology space, since what these guys are working on is pretty complex (but cool!)

featuredReview.headline: Great place to work for new entrants and industry veterans
featuredReview.pros: Hottest space in Enterprise software. Interesting challenges, lots of opportunities to contribute and make a difference. New focused approach is paying off with lots more traction on the commercial products.
featuredReview.cons: Hot space. Lots of competitors and tough incumbents. We have our work cut out for us to make a difference.

featuredReview.headline: Fun startup
featuredReview.pros: Great team, very skilled and professional. Awesome office environment, huge potential for growth.
featuredReview.cons: Due to the small size of the company the professional growth opportunities  are somewhat limited

featuredReview.headline: Summer Job
featuredReview.pros: Great group of employees through the season.
featuredReview.cons: Unpredictable weather (location) and current customer-base can make job straining.

featuredReview.headline: Slack is a great place to work
featuredReview.pros:
- amazing work/life balance
- great product 
- competitive salaries
- start up mindset
featuredReview.cons: Not that many cons I can think of

featuredReview.headline: If you want to do serious B2B marketing, this is the agency to join.
featuredReview.pros: If you enjoy and love B2B marketing, you'll be hard-pressed to find a better B2B agency to join. The company has a collaborative and civil culture, blue-chip B2B clients, interesting and challenging work assignments, strong branding and demand-generation chops, top talent in every area, a newly expanded and remodeled work space, above-average benefits and, after 30 years, a stellar global track record and reputation.
featuredReview.cons: Because Slack also is an integrated marketing communications agency, one of the first in the world going back to 1988, you have to personally work harder than you might at many other agencies to stay abreast of all the trends and developments across the entire marketing communications spectrum. Possibly a con to some, but a plus to others who know they'll be more marketable and valuable as their careers progress.

featuredReview.headline: I don't know what these people are talking about
featuredReview.pros:
So many pros!
Leadership is forward thinking and adaptable
Talented staff are recognized for their contributions
Room for growth--I can't count how many promotion announcements were made this year. Slack expands when it is time to expand and most definitely promote from within
Flex Fridays 
Casual dress code, friendly atmosphere, employee picnics and activities make it fun to be here
The work is challenging and rewarding
Salaries are totally fair--anyone who says otherwise is not comparing apples to apples
Top executives/leadership actually knows who you are. COO is so personable and thanks the worker bees all. the. time. Feels amazing
featuredReview.cons:
People complain about the outdated decor. Ok maybe the carpeting could be replaced but who cares. there are sections of the campus that are prettier than others but we have a nice courtyard, lobby, breakrooms, and honestly I kind of like the vintage feel of the offices and conference rooms. Reminds you that this is a family run business with a history.
They do try to make improvements constantly like updating the artwork and adding a cafe. They even surveyed employees about these changes.
But ok, I'll give you the carpet. It's old. Sure.
The only thing I'm not happy about is the health benefits. They are completely unaffordable for families. If my spouse's employer did not offer coverage then one of us would have to stay home, there is no way to afford both Slack's healthcare and daycare and have anything left to have a point.

featuredReview.headline: construction
featuredReview.cons: limited room for job advancement, and promotion

featuredReview.headline: Great place to work
featuredReview.pros: Fun environment conducive to bringing out the best in its staff.
featuredReview.cons: Long hour pre-Holiday season or at the last minute if a large order came in.

featuredReview.headline: Store Operator
featuredReview.pros: Great co-workers, contacts with large companies such as Coca-Cola and Herrs
featuredReview.cons: Negative reception from the franchise corporation. Constant change. Not open to change

featuredReview.headline: Awesome company
featuredReview.pros: The people are incredible. I am constantly surprised and humbled by the creativity and ingenuity here
featuredReview.cons: Not a place to go if you like hand-holding ... Robinhood prizes self-starters who take initiative

featuredReview.headline: Senior Account Executive
featuredReview.cons: Office Layout, Job roles, training, team building,
